Description: Terracotta figure fragment of tragic mask. Lower lip and lower part of face missing. Wide round eyes, furrowed brow and open mouth. Mould-made, pressed into one-piece mould, with simple back. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt with lime inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Ptolemaic parallels from life-size tragic masks found at Naukratis (Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.301.1899; Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA718; Greenock, McLean Museum & Art Gallery 1987.284).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.318) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
